segment.source: Develop MMOS test applications
segment.target: Develop MMOS test applications

segment.source: Develop MMOS test applications
segment.target: Develop MMOS test applications

segment.source: Develop MMOS test applications
segment.target: Develop MMOS test applications

segment.source: Developing user-mode tests in MMOS is very similar to developing user-mode applications.
segment.target: Developing user-mode tests in MMOS is very similar to developing user-mode applications.

segment.source: Test development in MMOS
segment.target: Test development in MMOS

segment.source: Use the following steps to create, deploy, and test a MMOS test application.
segment.target: Use the following steps to create, deploy, and test a MMOS test application.

segment.source: Create an app.
segment.target: Create an app.

segment.source: Add code to test the desired component and display or send those results as desired.
segment.target: Add code to test the desired component and display or send those results as desired.

segment.source: For example, this sample code can be used to display a console message in MMOS.
segment.target: For example, this sample code can be used to display a console message in MMOS.

segment.source: Build the test application in Visual Studio.
segment.target: Build the test application in Visual Studio.

segment.source: Locate the binaries generated when you built the app.
segment.target: Locate the binaries generated when you built the app.

segment.source: Typically they are in a subdirectory of the projects folder, such as MyProjectarmdebug.
segment.target: Typically they are in a subdirectory of the projects folder, such as MyProjectarmdebug.

segment.source: Sign the executable by using the sign.cmd script in the “%WPDKCONTENTROOT%Toolsbini386” folder, as shown in the example below.
segment.target: Sign the executable by using the sign.cmd script in the “%WPDKCONTENTROOT%Toolsbini386” folder, as shown in the example below.

segment.source: To test your app, copy it to the device in the C:Datatest directory by using FTP and run it via Telnet.
segment.target: To test your app, copy it to the device in the C:Datatest directory by using FTP and run it via Telnet.

segment.source: For more info, see Deploy and test a user-mode test application in MMOS.
segment.target: For more info, see Deploy and test a user-mode test application in MMOS.

segment.source: Libraries in MMOS
segment.target: Libraries in MMOS

segment.source: Adding a lib in MMOS is similar to adding a lib in the production OS.
segment.target: Adding a lib in MMOS is similar to adding a lib in the production OS.

segment.source: Currently, this default lib location for the kit is configured in Visual Studio.
segment.target: Currently, this default lib location for the kit is configured in Visual Studio.

segment.source: To add a lib in Visual Studio, select ProjectPropertiesConfiguration PropertiesVC++ DirectoriesInclude Directories.
segment.target: To add a lib in Visual Studio, select ProjectPropertiesConfiguration PropertiesVC++ DirectoriesInclude Directories.

segment.source: To use the MMOS libraries, append the following directory to the path.
segment.target: To use the MMOS libraries, append the following directory to the path.

segment.source: Add the arm directory.
segment.target: Add the arm directory.

segment.source: In Visual Studio, select ProjectPropertiesConfiguration PropertiesLinkerGeneralAdditional Library Directories.
segment.target: In Visual Studio, select ProjectPropertiesConfiguration PropertiesLinkerGeneralAdditional Library Directories.

segment.source: To use the MMOS libraries, append the following directories to the path.
segment.target: To use the MMOS libraries, append the following directories to the path.

segment.source: Security in MMOS
segment.target: Security in MMOS

segment.source: In development environments, user-mode test binaries can be test signed (not production signed).
segment.target: In development environments, user-mode test binaries can be test signed (not production signed).

segment.source: Use the process described in Sign binaries and packages to test sign the binaries.
segment.target: Use the process described in Sign binaries and packages to test sign the binaries.

segment.source: If the test binaries are not signed and code integrity checking is active as it normally is, you will receive an error message similar to the following in the debug window.
segment.target: If the test binaries are not signed and code integrity checking is active as it normally is, you will receive an error message similar to the following in the debug window.
